importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the plane crash, which occurred on September 18, 2025, marks a significant event involving the death of a prominent songwriter, prompting public and media attention to aviation safety and pilot communication protocols.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame of the incident, specifically the flight and crash on September 18, 2025, is central to understanding the sequence of events and the communication failure that led to the tragedy.

keyTakeAways: Brett James, a Grammy-winning songwriter known for collaborations with Taylor Swift, Bon Jovi, Keith Urban, and Kenny Chesney, died in a plane crash on September 18, 2025, in Franklin, North Carolina.

The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) reported that the plane entered a 'tightening spiral' due to a radio communication failure, with James failing to tune to the common traffic advisory frequency despite being instructed to do so.

James had requested a visual approach to runway 7, which was approved by air traffic control, but he never changed the frequency and instead announced his position incorrectly, leading to loss of contact and eventual crash.
The aircraft involved was a Cirrus SR22T, and no mechanical issues were found in the wreckage according to the NTSB preliminary report.
The incident raises concerns about communication protocols in aviation, particularly in scenarios where pilots and controllers rely on radio frequencies and visual approaches.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Brett James is the central figure whose plane crashed, making him the primary subject of the article and a symbol of the loss of a major creative force in music.

namedEntities.name: National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB)

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The NTSB conducted a preliminary investigation into the crash, providing official findings on the cause of the accident and communication failure.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The planned visual approach to runway 7 was a key part of the flight plan and the point of failure in communication.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: James’s breakthrough collaboration with Carrie Underwood marked a pivotal moment in his career, illustrating his significance in music history.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Grammy-winning songwriter Brett James, known for his collaborations with major music stars such as Taylor Swift, Bon Jovi, Keith Urban, and Kenny Chesney, died in a plane crash on September 18, 2025, in Franklin, North Carolina. The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) reported that the Cirrus SR22T plane he was piloting entered a 'tightening spiral' after a failure to tune to the common traffic advisory frequency (CTAF), despite being instructed to do so. James had requested a visual approach to runway 7, which was approved, but failed to update his radio frequency and instead announced his position incorrectly, leading to a loss of communication and subsequent crash. The NTSB found no mechanical issues in the aircraft. The incident underscores critical issues in aviation communication protocols and highlights the broader cultural impact of James’s music career.
title: Songwriter Brett James’ plane enters spiral before crashing, NTSB says
